Title: Golar announces exit from LNG shipping market with sale of its last LNG tanker
Description: Floating LNG solutions player Golar LNG has announced the exit from the LNG shipping segment with the sale of the Golar Arctic LNG tanker, as it begins its transition to an FLNG infrastructure-focused company.
Author: JS

Title: Dampier port shut ahead of Cyclone Zelia landfall, LNG loadings likely affected
Description: The Pilbara Ports Authority, operating several ports in Western Australia, has closed the Dampier ports, hosting the 4.9 mtpa Pluto and 16.4 mtpa NWS LNG plants,  from today onwards and until further notice, as the region braces for tropical cyclone Zelia due to make landfall tonight.
Author: JS

Title: Egypt to deploy third FSRU at Ain Sukhna to cover LNG demand in June-November
Description: Egypt and Turkey have signed a deal for a floating storage regasification unit (FSRU) to be deployed at Egypt's Ain Sukhna LNG terminal to cover peak summer demand, with the 170,000 m3 Ertugrul Gazi, currently deployed at Turkey's 4.1 mtpa Dortyol terminal, the most likely contender.
Author: JS
